summary: human coronaviruses (HCoVs) are responsible for 5–30% of all upper respiratory tract infections in humans. their involvement in lower respiratory tract illness and gastroenteritis has also been reported. nsp15 of HCoV-229E has been reported to prevent viral RNA accumulation. nsp15s from sARS-CoV and mouse hepatitis virus share 42 and 40% sequence identity, respectively, with nsp15 from HCoV-229E. trimeric nsp15 from HCoV-229E was successfully obtained by mutating Ile26 and Asn52 to alanine. the complete gene fragment encoding HCoV-229E nsp15 was amplified by PCR using the forward primer 5′-ACCGGGGATCCGGTTTAGAGAACATTGCTT-3′. the resulting PCR product was digested with BamHI and XhoI, and was clon eluted fraction was mixed with 20 ml stock buffer (20 mM HEPES pH 7.5, 500 mM NaCl, 5 mM Mg2+) the protein was ultrafiltered to 8 mg ml1 for subsequent crystallization. the purity of the protein was monitored by 12.0% SDS–PAGE followed by staining with Coomassie Brilliant Blue.
